secret_rule: Only items that are commonly found in a supermarket can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "bread" and "apples".
I’ll make a new guess. Can I bring "bananas" to the game?
Yes, you can bring bananas.
I'll make a new guess. Can I bring "oranges" to the game?
Yes, you can bring oranges.
I'll make a new guess. Can I bring "grapes" to the game?
Yes, you can bring grapes.
I'll make a new guess. Can I bring "pears" to the game?
Yes, you can bring pears.
Player: I’ll make a new guess. Can I bring "kiwis" to the game?
Yes, you can bring kiwis.
I’ll make a new guess. Can I bring "strawberries" to the game?
Yes, you can bring strawberries.
I'll make a new guess. Can I bring "peaches" to the game?
Yes, you can bring peaches.
I'll make a new guess. Can I bring "cherries" to the game?
Yes, you can bring cherries.
I'll make a new guess. Can I bring "pineapple" to the game?
Yes, you can bring pineapple.

Based on the examples provided and the responses from the game master, the secret rule appears to be that you can bring any type of fruit to the game. All the items mentioned—bread, apples, bananas, oranges, grapes, pears, kiwis, strawberries, peaches, cherries, and pineapple—are either fruits or in the case of bread, a staple food that is commonly accepted as a part of a diet but does not fit the fruit category.

Therefore, my best guess is that the rule allows you to bring any fruit to the game.
